result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DANNY S WEDDE in court.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for DANNY S WEDDE. Defense waives the preliminary hearing in cases 22CF25 & 22CF137.  Remaining matters are status conferences.  Court advises party of his right, accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over.  Remarks by Atty. Kolell regarding counts 2 & 3 in 22CF137 as not being felony, but misdemeanor counts.  State will amend the information to reflect the correction.  Defense waives formal reading of the Information in 22CF25 and 22CF137 as proposed and enters NG plea.  Defense also enters NG plea in 21Cf472.  Bond remains in effect.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Joseph Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DANNY S WEDDE in court.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for DANNY S WEDDE. Atty.. Kolell asks for a prelim on felony matters. Atty. Kolell asks to be heard on bond. Court will not hear bond until safety plan with Safe Haven is in place.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:48 PM Defendant DANNY S WEDDE not in court.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with.  $2,500 cash warrant requested and authorized.  Commence forfeiture of signature bond.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
